grendel.widgets
Class ToolBarButton

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--javax.swing.JComponent
                    |
                    +--javax.swing.AbstractButton
                          |
                          +--javax.swing.JButton
                                |
                                +--grendel.widgets.ToolBarButton
public class ToolBarButton
extends javax.swing.JButton
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener

The ToolBarButton class implements the standard Netscape toolbar button behaviour of painting a flat border normally, and a raised border when the mouse moves over it.

See Also:

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
Paints a loweredBevelBorder when the mouse is pressed. We have to have this since the default JButton behaviour is to simply make its background color darker.
Specified by:
mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
